qas.question: What event produced an expansion of the British cotton industry?
When was a new spinning machine patented that boosted cotton production?
What device did James Hargreaves invent?
What was Samuel Crompton's invention of 1775?
Whic British city was nicknamed "Cottonopolis" because of its cotton production?
What event produced an expansion of John Wyatt's cotton industry?
When was a new spinning machine patented that boosted frame production?
What was Samuel Crompton's invention of 1769?
Which British city was nicknamed "Cottonopolis" because of its frame production?

context: The advent of the <a0_0><b5_0>Industrial Revolution<b5_0/><a0_0/> in Britain provided a great boost to cotton manufacture, as textiles emerged as Britain's leading export. In <a1_0><b6_0>1738<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Lewis Paul and John Wyatt, of Birmingham, England, patented the roller spinning machine, as well as the flyer-and-bobbin system for drawing cotton to a more even thickness using two sets of rollers that traveled at different speeds. Later, the invention of the James Hargreaves' <a2_0><b7_0>spinning jenny<b7_0/><a2_0/> in 1764, Richard Arkwright's spinning frame in 1769 and Samuel Crompton's <a3_0><b8_0>spinning mule<b8_0/><a3_0/> in 1775 enabled British spinners to produce cotton yarn at much higher rates. From the late 18th century on, the British city of <a4_0><b9_0>Manchester<b9_0/><a4_0/> acquired the nickname "Cottonopolis" due to the cotton industry's omnipresence within the city, and Manchester's role as the heart of the global cotton trade.
